content: with a piece of scrap yarn in a contrasting 34 stitches for the back of the hand color then slip them back to left needle and 26 stitches for the palm continue with the pattern according to the chart this is where you ll pick up stitches for double pointed needles the thumb later right mitten 17 17 9 17 left mitten 17 17 17 9 at the end of the chart cut the yarn and pull through the remaning stitches to secure break cc and switch to mc join round careful them not to twist the stitches and knit the twisted rib *ktbl p* - repeat *-* until end of round thumbs repeat for 15 rounds total or until desired some knitters get a tighter gauge when length of cuff is reached knitting smaller pieces in the round so feel free to use a larger needle size on the make a latvian braid thumbs round 1 *witch cc k1 with mc k1* - repeat *-* until end of round pick up 11 stitches above and 11 stitches below round 2 place both strands in front of work the scrap yarn then remove the scrap yarn *pull cc strand under mc strand p1 pull mc by pulling out the stitches strand under cc strand and p1* - repeat *-* start at the arrows and knit one round until end of round according to chart c at the same time pick round 3 keep both strands in front of work up 1 stitch at each side of the thumb to *pull cc strand over mc strand p1 pull mc prevent holes strand over cc strand and p1* - repeat *-* until end of round at the end of the chart cut the yarn and pull through the remaining stitches to secure bring both strands to the back and continue them with chart a for right mitten or chart b for left mitten weave in and trim ends wash and block your mittens to even out the stitches make sure to catch your floats where there s longer sections of one color i usually catch my floats every 5th stitch by wrapping the yarns around each other on the back avoid catching the float on the same stitch on the next round in order to keep the floats invisible you could choose to do a ladderback jaquard instead of wrapping this pattern is available for free on ravelry 2 you may not sell or distribute this pattern chart a -
